content: the body continue with that pattern as established hint the best way to tell how far you should stop is to measure the swatch that you made of chart 3 switch to us4s complete chart 3 switch to us3s and knit until the sleeve reaches the desired length sans cuffs once the desired length is reached bind off steek stiches and knit 5 row in reverse stockinette stitch bind off all remaining stitches knit a second sleeve as established constructing sweater loosely whip stitch shoulders together steam sleeve area on body and sleeves using an iron without stretching it before attaching sleeves to the body make sure you reinforce the steek this will make it easier to cut later place sleeve against the body and mark the length of the sleeve on the body using the false side seam as your middle marker reinforce on both sides of the purl stich at least 4 st wide steek and cut attach sleeve to the body and fold over extra 5 row of reverse stockinette stitch to cover rough seam 4 cut sleeve steek and remove shoulder basting stitches pickup and knit all stitches along the outside of the steek and up to the collar opening in both directions knit at least 75 width of each color using a 3 needle bind off bind off all stitches in the cuff end color to the collar repeat for the other sleeve finishing collar and cuffs pick up and knit 110 stitches for all sizes along the neck opening k collar in a 1x1 twisted rib to desired length bind off in whatever style you prefer pick up stitches along cuffs join in the round knitting one row in blue while simultaneously decreasing stitches until you have 42 44 46 48 50 52 st k in a 1x1 twisted rib to desired length and bind off optional finishing touches -rings can be done using any method and stars are done using a duplicate stitch -f you want to you can finish the exposed arm steeks by either sewing loosely a ribbon over them block wear and dazzle the masses with your smile 5 6 chart 3 chart 2 chart 1 7 8 9 alternative
